title: Reorder About section, integrate portfolio images, and incorporate new leadership positioning copy

requirements.text: Move the About section so it appears above the Work Samples/Selected Work section on the landing page, and update the header navigation so “About” is the first tab/nav item (tab 1).

quotes: can you move the about to tab 1, and above work samples

acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page, the About section renders before the Selected Work section in the scroll order.
In the desktop header navigation, the first nav item is “About” and it smoothly scrolls to the About section.
Work and Contact navigation items still smoothly scroll to their respective sections and remain functional.

requirements.text: Add the images found in the provided portfolio file into the most relevant landing-page sections and case study pages (e.g., project thumbnails, case study section visuals), using static frontend assets.

quotes: can you add the images in the portfolio file to relevant sections and case studies

acceptanceCriteria: Relevant portfolio images are added to the frontend as static assets (not fetched from the backend) and are referenced from content/config where appropriate.
Selected Work project cards display updated thumbnails where portfolio images are available and relevant.
Case study pages include relevant images from the portfolio file, presented in a clean, minimal layout consistent with the existing design system.
All added images include appropriate alt text and do not break layout on mobile or desktop.

requirements.text: Slightly reword the provided “strategic architect / product leadership” text and incorporate it across the site in the most relevant, high-impact places (e.g., hero subhead/description, value propositions, and/or about content) while keeping all user-facing text in English.

quotes: use the below text  wiht slight rewording and incorporate it as appropriate in different parts of the site where relevant and most impactful ------ strategic architect capable of blending deep technical intuition with a sophisticated understanding of user behavioral economics
Product Strategy & Roadmap Sovereignty: Own the long-term vision and execution for high-priority product domains, ensuring alignment with global growth objectives and platform durability.
Technical & Behavioral Integration: Lead the intersection of engineering, data science, and user research to build features that solve complex social problems and drive deep user resonance.
Full-Lifecycle Governance: Oversee the end-to-end product development process—from discovery and conceptualization to global deployment and post-launch optimization.
Performance & Scale Intelligence: Establish advanced KPI frameworks, leveraging high-fidelity analytics and predictive models to guide evidence-based product decisions in real-time.
Cross-Functional Orchestration: Foster seamless collaboration between Design, Engineering, and Marketing teams to ensure a unified and frictionless user experience across all touchpoints.

acceptanceCriteria: The site’s hero/about/value-prop copy is updated to reflect the provided leadership themes with slight rewording (no verbatim copy dumps).
The updated copy reads naturally as a portfolio positioning statement for Manvi Drona and remains consistent with the site’s modern/minimal tone.
No user-facing text is added in any language other than English.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not introduce third-party integrations (no external CMS, no external image hosting requirements, no email service integration).
nonGoals: No new backend features or schema changes are required for this request.
No new authentication methods beyond existing Internet Identity.
No redesign of the overall visual theme beyond what is necessary to accommodate the new section order and added images.
